column4: Hello, I need help on an Ubuntu installation that continually crashes on bootup, both in regular installation mode and in safe mode. Can anyone help?
what kind of an error is displayed when it crashes?

occasionally I get a kernel panic, but it's been quite varied. Rarely I'm able to get to a desktop screen and attempt an installation, but it always crashes out. It sounds like a hardware issue, but I can't imagine what could be causing it.
have you tried running the memory tester from the installation CD?
it could be a memory issue
yes, I thought so as well, but the memory test all checked out.
odd. Which distribution version?
do you have a Wireless NIC?
no, just the ethernet that came with the Mboard
too bad, there was an issue in the broadcom driver that caused something similar
ahh, I wish it were something with an easy explanation
you could try an older version just to see if the problem is just in 7.04
Thanks, I will give that a try

I think this might be a little telling... this computer has gone through a few moves overseas, and after trying to install XP recently I discovered sound drivers would install, but no sound would be produced.
I'm suspecting there could be some real quirky hardware issues
it could be a motherboard issue then. Usually when i've run in to motherboard issues it's more like on/off type of thing
the only way to find out for sure is to start switching parts, and that's no fun
Yeah... I've been messing with this thing for a few days already and am about ready to start again from scratch.
I'll give Edgy another try and see what happens. Thanks again for your help!
no problem, i hope you get the computer up and running
